intro: Chamaefilix fragrans, commonly known as sweet germander, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It belongs to the family Cupressaceae, which includes cypress and juniper. The plant is characterized by its dense, evergreen foliage and small, fragrant yellow flowers that bloom in the spring. It typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and prefers full sun to partial shade. Due to its aromatic properties and ornamental value, it is often cultivated in gardens.
